vi:
To the champions.
 Mommy, may I play with Paquito? Pretty please.

en: - Sí, vete a los juegos de enfrente. - ¡Sí!
vi: Yes, in that playground over there.

en: - Si quieres, lo acompaño. - No, tranquilo. Aquí lo vemos.
vi:
Yes!
 You want me to go?
 No, no, no, no, we're good. We see him from here.
-It was even worse than that. -What? Really?

en: ¿Cómo les fue? ¿Sigue en alto el nombre de la familia?
vi: So how'd it go? Is the family name still up there?
Yes, we won!
- Yay! -Wonderful!
-Very good. -Solid work, my boy.
-Um… -Dad, I was the goalkeeper this time.
I saved a penalty.
-They lifted her up on their shoulders. - What?

en: Oye, muchas felicidades, Sof. Muy bien.
vi: Hey, congratulations, Sof! That's awesome!
Ho-- Hold on. How was it you?

en: Vi la oportunidad y la tomé.
vi: An opportunity turned up.

en: A veces las victorias vienen de quien menos te las esperas.
vi: Sometimes victory comes from who you least expect.

en: Aunque, al parecer, si el gane viene de una mujer Lemus, a nadie le importa.
vi: But it looks like if the achievement comes from a Lemus woman,

then no one really cares!
 Ooh!

en: Igual de voluntariosa que su madre.
vi: Just as stubborn as her mother.
Hold on a second. No, princess.

en: Te entiendo perfectamente y sabes que estoy muy orgulloso de ti.
vi: I hear you loud and clear, really. You know I'm so proud of you.

en: Te prometo que no vuelve a pasar.
vi: I promise you, this won't happen again.

en: ¡Mi campeona! Qué bien, oye, muy bien.
vi: - Bzzz! -My champion! That's so great!

en: Chimi, tienes el video, por supuesto.
vi: Very good! Chimi, you recorded it, didn't you?
I sure did.

en: Vuelvo, tengo algo muy importante que hacer.
vi: Um, there's something really important I gotta do.
Okay.
- Hello, everyone! -How was it?
We bring you Da Zapopans.

-Whoo!
 Great! Hit it!

en: Oigan, ¿es Santi el que está tocando?
vi:
Ooh. Okay.
 Hold on. Is that Santi on stage?
-Santi? -Yeah!
-It is! -Oh!
-I gotta see this. -Come on, let's go.

Look at Santi.
 ♪ I don't wear luxury clothes… ♪
-Come on, Joaco, let's go. -Take a video, will you?

en: - ¿En serio? - Voy a echar un whiskito con mi "suebro".
vi:
Are you serious?
 I'm gonna have another whiskey with my father-in-law here. Yeah?

en: - ¿Es en serio? - Vámonos. Sí. Gracias, Chimi.

vi:
Thanks, Chimi.
 -Oh, hey. -A little cheers.

-Cheers to you. -Hey!
 ♪ Let's sing while we listen to Nirvana ♪

♪ Crush Lobuki ♪
 ♪ Crush Lobuki… ♪
 Let's go, Santi!
Let's go, Santi!

I give you, Santiago Echegaray!
 -Whoo!
♪ Crush Lobuki… ♪

en: Los trajes de baño van en ciclo delicado.
vi:
-The swimsuits go on a delicate cycle.
 Oh yeah. Thanks. Hmm.

en: Hace años no lavábamos ropa juntos.
vi: It's been a while since we did laundry.
Yeah, since Joaquín.

en: Creo que ya la hemos llevado mejor.
vi: I think we're getting on better.

en: - Ah. - Hasta fui a jugar golf con él, al club.
vi: - Oh? -I even played golf with him at the club.
Don't remind me.

en: Las mismas risas falsas, los chismes, los juicios.
vi: The same fake laughter, all the gossiping, all the judgement…
It's a shitty environment.
But you know what?

en: Después de haber estado todo el día, hoy me di cuenta de algo.
vi: After having spent the day at the club, I realize something now.
I don't want that anymore.
I mean, I hate that bullshit club.

en: Y es que ya no soy la misma.
vi: And it's just that I'm not that same person.
It wasn't all bad. Did you see what your kids achieved today?

en: Ve lo que lograron hoy tus chamacones.
No sé de dónde salieron tan chingones.
vi: I don't know where they got that talent from.

en: Ver a Santi hoy ahí en el escenario.
vi: Watching Santi on that stage,
flourishing.

en: Ver a Sof que… que casi ya puede lazar un toro sola.
vi:
Watching Sofía,
 nearly lassoing a bull on her own.

en: Has sido una gran influencia para ellos, Gaby.
vi: You've been such an incredible influence for them.

en: Me das demasiado crédito. Tú ya habías hecho bastante.
vi: You give me too much credit. You've already done a lot.

en: Desde que llegaste a la casa, todo ha sido mejor.
vi: Since you arrived here everything's better.
And…

en: a veces me muero de celos.
vi: sometimes I'm so jealous.

en: Porque siento que todo el mundo se está abriendo caminos, y…
vi: Because I feel like everyone is paving a way by themselves and…
and I'm stuck in the corner,
walking around in goddamn circles.

en: A veces quisiera poder tener el valor que…
vi: Sometimes I wish I could be as brave as…

en: que tuvieron mis hijos hoy para poder romper con todo
vi: my kids were today, so I could just break the cycle
and let it all just go to hell,

en: y poderme subir a ese escenario a poder cantar lo que realmente me…
vi: and… and to get up on that stage and be able to sing what really makes my…
makes my heart feel whole.
Why don't you do it?
Thank you, Gabriel.

en: Mm. Chimi, vente. Está buenísima la repetición del partido.
vi: Hm! Chimi, come here. This match replay is super-good.

Hey! Hey! Hey!
 Referee!
Joaquín…

en: llevamos bastante tiempo jugando tiempos extras,
vi: I think we've been playing extra time for a while now.

en: y la verdad es que no quiero llegar a penales contigo.
vi: And if I'm honest, I don't wanna get to penalties with you.
Chimi, what are you trying to say?

en: Por más que me tires unos pases increíbles a mi centro,
vi: Although it's true that you've scored some incredible goals,

en: contigo siempre me siento fuera de lugar.
vi: whenever I'm with you, I feel offside.
Chimi, what the hell?

en: O sea, pon atención, por favor. Eso no fue fuera de lugar.
vi: I mean, pay attention, would you? That wasn't offside.
-What are you trying to say here? -Um, yes. It seems extra time is over.

en: y el partido ya se acabó.
vi: The match is done.

en: Joaquín, quiero el divorcio, y, esta vez, no hay vuelta atrás.
vi: Joaquín, I want the divorce. And I won't look back this time.
Is it a red card?
You're sent off.
